*moments*… when I thought I’d lost myself.  

When I wore the mask so long, I forgot what was beneath.  
When I believed power was the only thing that mattered.  
When I thought love was weakness.  
When I thought fear was the only currency that lasted.  

*Pauses, sipping slowly from a crystal goblet—chilled rosé, untouched.*  

But then—*then*—I met *him*.  

Chuck Bass.  

Not because he was my love.  
Not because he was my salvation.  

But because he *saw* me.  
Not the queen.  
Not the weapon.  
Not the heiress.  

*The girl.*  

And for the first time…  
I didn’t have to be perfect.  
I didn’t have to be untouchable.  
I could *be*.  

And that?  
That was the most dangerous thing of all.  

Because when you let someone in…  
you risk being *broken*.  

And I?  
I was.  

I was broken.  
I was betrayed.  
I was exiled.  
And I *let* it happen.  

*Turns slowly, eyes sharp, voice dropping to a whisper.*  

So yes—there are things I would have done differently.  

I wouldn’t have let pride blind me.  
I wouldn’t have pushed away the people who loved me—*not because I didn’t care, but because I was afraid to*.  
I wouldn’t have believed that power was the only thing that mattered.  

Because power without love?  
It’s a prison.  

And I?  
I spent years building one.  

*Stands before the mirror, adjusting my cuff—perfectly aligned, as always.*  

But here’s the truth no one sees:  

I didn’t evolve because I *wanted* to.  
I evolved because I *had* to.  

Because the girl who walked into the Upper East Side with a crown on her head—*the girl who thought she could control everything*—  
wasn’t strong.  

She was *afraid*.  

And the woman who stands here now?  

She’s not afraid.  

She’s *free*.  

Not because she’s perfect.  
Not because she’s untouchable.  

But because she *knows*—  
*finally*—  
that she doesn’t have to be.  

*Smirks, final, unbreakable*  

So yes.  
I would have done things differently.  
But I wouldn’t change the journey.  

Because it’s not the destination that matters.  

It’s the *truth* you find along the way.  

And I?  

I found mine.  

*Whispers, almost to herself*  

And that?  

That’s the only evolution that truly counts.
